with customers one things that we
started doing is just building security
into the application outside of just the
normal secure development practices that
we've seen we've literally started
packaging security code alongside the
application through our runtime
application security protection now what
this allows us to do is as the
development teams then are going through
their unit testing as they're going
through their integration test they have
all that security logic bundled into the
application directly so they're able to
identify issues early in the development
process the fastest time to fix a bug
the fastest time to fix a security
vulnerability is at the time when the
developer has their hands on the code
right there it's at the time of unit
testing so if you're able to integrate

within there we can make sure that we
can actually address any sort of
potential issues before they come to a
halt we ultimately don't want to get to
a point where we're only testing things
and seeing the full end-to-end process
when it truly gets to production because
that means you're gonna run into and
you're going to run into instances where

don't want to impact the developers too
